title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6035.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6035.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

When used in this Part: (a) The term law enforcement agency shall
mean any law enforcement agency or department of any municipality, any police
district, or any agency, department, commission, authority or public benefit
corporation of the state of New York employing a police officer or police
officers as that term is defined in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (j), (k), (1), (o), (p) and (s) of subdivision thirty-four of section
1.20
of the Criminal Procedure

Law. (b) The term council shall
mean the New York State Law Enforcement Agency Accreditation Council. (c) The term program shall mean the New York

State Law Enforcement Agency Accreditation Program. (d) The term program staff shall mean
employees of the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services who have
been assigned to work on the New York State Law Enforcement Agency

Accreditation Program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6035.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
